comments.body: We will hopefully soon - as most of the stability problems with tests are fixed now, I am resuming working on this :)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +166,170 @@        super-init-not-called,  # BasPH: ignored for now but should be fixed somewhere in the future
        arguments-differ,  # Doesn't always raise valid messages
        import-error,  # Requires installing Airflow environment in CI task which takes long, therefore ignored. Tests should fail anyways if deps are missing. Possibly un-ignore in the future if we ever use pre-built Docker images for CI.
        fixme  # There should be a good reason for adding a TODO

comments.body: Can we also lower that value? (my preference is `200`)

Big plus for smaller scripts. However, especially in Airflow, there are many many long scripts (On current master 213 with >200 lines, vs 17 with >1000 lines). Therefore I think lowering the max lines would introduce too many conflicts at this point in time.

Agree with @BasPH . Especially if we decide to go file-by-file rather than line-by-line having this high for now is a good idea. 

We should have a separate project of breaking stuff up to smaller files soon :)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +354,358 @@
# Maximum number of lines in a module.
max-module-lines=1000

# List of optional constructs for which whitespace checking is disabled. `dict-
